help: It navigates to a given url when the browser is already open.
Equivalent to pressing back button.
Quits browser closing all windows.
Saves the current webpage as pdf. Playwright has to run headless for this to work.
Checks the page against accessibility guidelines.
This will click on any element which contains this text. Remember, there may be multiple element containing same text.
Use tag that you see in the HTML dom containing the text. You can inspect DOM to find the tag.
You can click text relative to another text. Use right/left/above/below as direction.
You can click text relative to another text. Use right/left/above/below as direction. It has to be input/textarea.
The target has to be a field where we can input text.
Use the text of the icon. The text can be found in the HTML aria or alt attribute.
Use the text of the icon. The text can be found in the HTML aria or alt attribute. The icon can be either on right or left side.
Use it when you are expecting either of the two texts depending on the data entered.
This will type the value wherever the cursor is. This should ideally be preceded by click to activate a input element.
This should ideally be either existing input value or placeholder text.
This would look for an element with exact work and would avoid matching elements which has this text.
The order is as determined by Playwright.

step: |Wait until one of the texts |successfully,,error |is displayed|
|Wait until one of the elements |#progressbar,,#someValue |is displayed|
|Wait until one of the elements |#success,,#error |is enabled|

help: This is to get the complete text for partial text. This is helpful if there is some dynamic content in the text.
This is to get the next column text. It can also be used to get the full text from the right of another text.
Ensure "use mock" is enabled in setup. Works only with playwright. Will use the mock response for the requests matching url pattern.
